subject: junit trying to run inexistant .class method!
msgSnippet: I have absolutely no idea why Junit is trying to run one of my tests as if its .class field was a test method. The test itself has already run as part of its
messageBody:
I have absolutely no idea why Junit is trying to run one of my tests as
if its ".class" field was a test method.
The test itself has already run as part of its own package but it looks
like Junit tries to run the class as if it was a package and the field
as if it was a method... weird!
An example of which can be seen here:
http://nagafix.co.uk/products/metastores/doc/tests/
(under com.metastores.system.meta.source.DefaultSourceTest)
This class is no different from the other tests in the same directory
(in fact it inherits its test methods from the same superclass as
another test)
I am using Ant to run these tests (no special options or filters)
This is not a major issue, all it does is make it look like a test has
failed when it does not even exist.. And I'd like to know why.

Cheers
Antoine
